sections.title: PART 1 Questions 1–10
sections.instructions: Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD AND/OR A NUMBER for each answer.

questions.prompt: making sure the beach does not have 1 __________ on it
next task is taking action to attract 3 __________ to the place
identifying types of 4 __________
building a new 5 __________
walk across the sands and reach the 6 __________
wear appropriate 7 __________
suitable for 8 __________ to participate in
making 9 __________ out of wood
cost of session (no camping): 10 £ __________

sections.title: PART 2 Questions 11–20
sections.instructions:
Questions 11–14: Choose the correct letter, A, B or C.
Questions 15–16: Choose TWO letters, A–E.
Questions 17–18: Choose TWO letters, A–E.
Questions 19–20: Choose TWO letters, A–E.

questions.prompt: What is the maximum number of people who can stand on each side of the boat?
options: A 9

questions.prompt: What colour are the tour boats?
options: A dark red
B jet black
C light green

questions.prompt: Which lunchbox is suitable for someone who doesn't eat meat or fish?
options: A Lunchbox 1
B Lunchbox 2
C Lunchbox 3

questions.prompt: What should people do with their litter?
options: A take it home
B hand it to a member of staff
C put it in the bins provided on the boat

questions.prompt: Which TWO features of the lighthouse does Lou mention? (Choose TWO)
options: A why it was built
B who built it
C how long it took to build
D who staffed it
E what it was built with

questions.prompt: Which TWO features of the lighthouse does Lou mention? (Choose the other answer)
options: A why it was built
B who built it
C how long it took to build
D who staffed it
E what it was built with

questions.prompt: Which TWO types of creature might come close to the boat? (Choose TWO)
options: A sea eagles
B fur seals
C dolphins
D whales
E penguins

questions.prompt: Which TWO types of creature might come close to the boat? (Choose the other answer)
options: A sea eagles
B fur seals
C dolphins
D whales
E penguins

questions.prompt: Which TWO points does Lou make about the caves? (Choose TWO)
options: A Only large tourist boats can visit them
B The entrances to them are often blocked
C It is too dangerous for individuals to go near them
D Someone will explain what is inside them
E They cannot be reached on foot

questions.prompt: Which TWO points does Lou make about the caves? (Choose the other answer)
options: A Only large tourist boats can visit them
B The entrances to them are often blocked
C It is too dangerous for individuals to go near them
D Someone will explain what is inside them
E They cannot be reached on foot

sections.title: PART 3 Questions 21–30
sections.instructions:
Questions 21–26: Choose the correct letter, A, B or C.
Questions 27–30: Choose FOUR answers from the box and write the correct letter, A–F, next to questions 27–30.

questions.prompt: What problem did both Diana and Tim have when arranging their work experience?
options: A making initial contact with suitable farms
B organising transport to and from the farm
C finding a placement for the required length of time

questions.prompt: Tim was pleased to be able to help
options: A a lamb that had a broken leg
B a sheep that was having difficulty giving birth
C a newly born lamb that was having trouble feeding

questions.prompt: Diana says the sheep on her farm
options: A were of various different varieties
B were mainly reared for their meat
C had better quality wool than sheep on the hills

questions.prompt: What did the students learn about adding supplements to chicken feed?
options: A These should only be given if specially needed
B It is worth paying extra for the most effective ones
C The amount given at one time should be limited

questions.prompt: What happened when Diana was working with dairy cows?
options: A She identified some cows incorrectly
B She accidentally threw some milk away
C She made a mistake when storing milk

questions.prompt: What did both farmers mention about vets and farming?
options: A Vets are failing to cope with some aspects of animal health
B There needs to be a fundamental change in the training of vets
C Some jobs could be done by the farmer rather than by a vet

questions.prompt: Medical terminology
options: A Tim found this easier than expected
B Tim thought this was not very clearly organised
C Diana may do some further study on this
D They both found the reading required for this was difficult
E Tim was shocked at something he learned on this module
F They were both surprised how little is known about some aspects of this

options: A Tim found this easier than expected
B Tim thought this was not very clearly organised
C Diana may do some further study on this
D They both found the reading required for this was difficult
E Tim was shocked at something he learned on this module
F They were both surprised how little is known about some aspects of this

questions.prompt: Animal disease
options: A Tim found this easier than expected
B Tim thought this was not very clearly organised
C Diana may do some further study on this
D They both found the reading required for this was difficult
E Tim was shocked at something he learned on this module
F They were both surprised how little is known about some aspects of this

questions.prompt: Wildlife medication
options: A Tim found this easier than expected
B Tim thought this was not very clearly organised
C Diana may do some further study on this
D They both found the reading required for this was difficult
E Tim was shocked at something he learned on this module
F They were both surprised how little is known about some aspects of this

sections.title: PART 4 Questions 31–40
sections.instructions: Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD ONLY for each answer.

questions.prompt: Mazes are a type of 31 __________
32 __________ is needed to navigate through a maze
the word 'maze' is derived from a word meaning a feeling of 33 __________
they have frequently been used in 34 __________ and prayer
Ancient carvings on 35 __________ have been found across many cultures
Ancient Greeks used the symbol on 36 __________
The largest surviving example of a turf labyrinth once had a big 37 __________ at its centre
walking a maze can reduce a person's 38 __________ rate
patients who can't walk can use 'finger labyrinths' made from 39 __________
research has shown that Alzheimer's sufferers experience less 40 __________
